answer.apache.org.name: Apache Answer
answer.apache.org.description: Apache Answer is an open-source question-and-answer platform that helps you build a community around your brand or product. It provides tools for creating forums with gamification and integrations.

apple.com.ipad.name: Apple iPad
apple.com.ipad.description: For Apple laptops, the iPad is a versatile second screen that can be used for note-taking or as a second monitor and whiteboard.

awario.com.name: Awario
awario.com.description: Awario is a social media monitoring tool that helps you track mentions of your brand, competitors, and industry keywords across social media platforms and the web. Includes X (Twitter), Facebook, Instagram, Reddit, YouTube, Vimeo, Forums, Blogs, etc.

brand24.com.name: Brand24
brand24.com.description: Brand24 is a social media monitoring tool that helps you track mentions of your brand, competitors, and industry keywords across social media platforms and the web.

buffer.com.name: Buffer
buffer.com.description: Buffer is a social media management platform for scheduling posts and managing multiple social media accounts. Free plan allows unlimited posts from 10 queued at a time across three channels from the supported list including Bluesky, Google Business, LinkedIn, Pinterest, TikTok, YouTube, Facebook, Instagram, Mastodon, Threads, X (Twitter).

canva.com.name: Canva
canva.com.description: Canva is a graphic design platform that allows users to create social media graphics, presentations, posters, documents, and other visual content. It provides a user-friendly interface with drag-and-drop features and a vast library of templates and design elements.

discord.com.name: Discord
discord.com.description: Discord is a communication platform designed for creating communities. It provides tools for voice, video, and text communication, making it suitable for community building, gaming, and other collaborative activities. Discord is widely used for community management and engagement including support.

discourse.org.name: Discourse
discourse.org.description: Discourse is an open-source or hosted discussion platform that helps you build a community around your brand or product. It provides tools for creating forums, managing discussions, and engaging with your community.

docusaurus.io.name: Docusaurus
docusaurus.io.description: Docusaurus is an open-source static site generator designed for building documentation websites. It is built by Facebook and supports Markdown, versioning, and localization.

draw.io.name: Draw.io
draw.io.description: Draw.io is a free online diagramming tool that allows users to create flowcharts, network diagrams, UML diagrams, and other types of visual representations. It features a user-friendly interface with drag-and-drop functionality and supports collaboration through cloud storage or local filesystem integration.

fedica.com.name: Fedica
fedica.com.description: Fedica is a platform for posting across social media platforms. The free plan allows for unlimited posts across nine platforms including Facebook, Tiktok, X (Twitter), YouTube, LinkedIn, Pinterest, Threads, Bluesky, and Mastodon. Paid plans provide tooling for analytics and performance tracking.

figma.com.name: Figma
figma.com.description: Figma is a web-based interface design tool that allows users to create, prototype, and collaborate on designs in real-time. It is widely used for UI/UX design, enabling teams to work together seamlessly on projects, share feedback, and iterate quickly.

flarum.org.name: Flarum
flarum.org.description: Flarum is a free, open-source forum software that is designed to be simple, fast, and beautiful. It provides a modern discussion platform with a focus on user experience and extensibility.

gatsbyjs.com.name: Gatsby
gatsbyjs.com.description: Gatsby is a React-based open-source framework for building fast, modern websites and applications. It uses GraphQL to pull in data from various sources and generate static pages for optimal web performance. Gatsby is known for its speed, scalability, and ability to integrate with various CMSs and APIs.

gitbook.com.name: Gitbook
gitbook.com.description: Gitbook is a documentation platform that allows teams to create, manage, and share documentation easily using Markdown. It provides features for real-time collaboration, version control, and integration with various tools.

github.com.features-discussions.name: GitHub Discussions
github.com.features-discussions.description: GitHub Discussions is a feature of GitHub that allows you to create discussion forums for individual repositories or a GitHub organization overall. It provides tools for managing discussions, engaging with your community, and building a knowledge base around your projects.

gohugo.io.name: Hugo
gohugo.io.description: Hugo is a fast and flexible static site generator written in Go. It is designed for speed and simplicity, allowing users to create websites quickly without the need for a database. Hugo supports a wide range of content types and is known for its powerful templating system and extensive theming capabilities.

hootsuite.com.name: Hootsuite
hootsuite.com.description: Hootsuite is a social media management platform that supports post scheduling, direct messages, and social listening across social media channels. The entry level plan provides tools for analytics and performance across eight channels with a tiered pricing by volume for posting to Instagram, Facebook, Tiktok, X (Twitter), YouTube, LinkedIn, Pinterest, Threads.

ignitetech.ai.softwarelibrary-answerhub.name: AnswerHub
ignitetech.ai.softwarelibrary-answerhub.description: AnswerHub, acquired by IgniteTech, is a community platform that provides tools for building and managing online communities. It offers features for discussion forums, Q&A knowledge management, and community engagement.

jekyllrb.com.name: Jekyll
jekyllrb.com.description: Jekyll is a simple, blog-aware static site generator written in Ruby that takes plain text files and converts them into a complete static website. It is often used with GitHub Pages to create personal, project, or organizational websites. Jekyll supports various templating features and allows for easy content management through Markdown files.

microsoft.com.powerpoint.name: Microsoft PowerPoint
microsoft.com.powerpoint.description: PowerPoint is one of the most widely used presentation tools. It allows users to create slides with text, images, charts, animations, and multimedia. It is suited for business, education, and personal use.

mintlify.com.name: Mintlify
mintlify.com.description: Mintlify is a documentation platform that allows teams to create, manage, and share documentation easily. It provides features for real-time collaboration, version control, and integration with various tools.

mkdocs.org.name: MkDocs
mkdocs.org.description: MkDocs is a static site generator that's geared towards project documentation. It uses Markdown for writing content and provides a simple way to create and maintain documentation sites.

mogics.com.name: MOGICS Super Bagel
mogics.com.description: Travel power strip and adapter with multiple outlets and USB ports, designed for travelers to charge multiple devices at once. It is compact, lightweight, and has a built-in surge protector.

nextra.site.name: Nextra
nextra.site.description: Nextra is a static site generator for building documentation websites using React and Next.js. It supports Markdown and provides a simple way to create and maintain documentation sites with a focus on performance and ease of use.

obsproject.com.name: Open Broadcaster Software (OBS)
obsproject.com.description: OBS is a free and open-source software for video recording and live streaming. It allows users to capture real-time video and audio, mix them, and stream or record the output.

omnigroup.com.omnigraffle.name: OmniGraffle
omnigroup.com.omnigraffle.description: OmniGraffle is a diagramming and digital illustration application for macOS and iOS. It is used for creating precise, beautiful graphics such as website wireframes, electrical systems, family trees, and maps. OmniGraffle provides a range of tools for drawing shapes, connecting lines, and adding text, making it suitable for both technical and creative projects.

open.vanillaforums.com.name: Vanilla Forums
open.vanillaforums.com.description: Vanilla Forums became Higher Logic Vanilla but continues as an open-source community forum and discussion platform. It provides tools for creating forums, managing discussions, and engaging with your community.

prezi.com.name: Prezi
prezi.com.description: Prezi is a presentation tool that uses AI to create better and faster presentations. It allows non-linear storytelling, making presentations more dynamic and engaging.

readme.io.name: Readme
readme.io.description: Readme is a platform for creating and managing API documentation, developer portals, and knowledge bases. It provides tools for interactive API documentation, versioning, and collaboration.

readthedocs.com.name: ReadtheDocs
readthedocs.com.description: Read the Docs is a documentation hosting platform that automates the building, versioning, and hosting of documentation. It supports various formats including Sphinx and MkDocs, and integrates with version control systems like Git.

reddit.com.r-onebag.name: One Bag Subreddit
reddit.com.r-onebag.description: A community dedicated to the art of packing light and traveling efficiently with just one travel backpack / bag.

slack.com.name: Slack
slack.com.description: Slack is a collaboration hub that connects your work with the people you work with. It provides tools for team communication, file sharing, and integration with other services to streamline workflows. It is often used for community building and management including providing technical support and engaging with users.

slides.google.com.name: Google Slides
slides.google.com.description: Google Slides is a cloud-based presentation tool that allows real-time collaboration. It supports text, images, video embedding, and themes, making it popular for teamwork.

slido.com.name: Slido
slido.com.description: Slido is an audience interaction tool that allows for live polls, Q&A sessions, and quizzes during presentations. It helps engage the audience and gather feedback in real-time.

sproutsocial.com.name: Sprout Social
sproutsocial.com.description: Sprout Social is a social media management platform that provides tools for scheduling, publishing, analytics, and engagement across social media channels. Supports many integrations and multiple accounts across channels.

stackoverflow.com.name: StackOverflow
stackoverflow.com.description: StackOverflow is a question-and-answer platform for developers and programmers. It allows users to ask questions, provide answers, and engage in discussions about programming topics. It is widely used for community support and knowledge sharing in the software development industry.

starlight.astro.build.name: Starlight
starlight.astro.build.description: Starlight is a static site generator designed for building documentation websites. It is built on top of Astro and provides a simple way to create and maintain documentation sites with a focus on performance and ease of use. Starlight supports Markdown and offers features like theming, search, and versioning.

ziploc.com.name: Ziploc Bags
ziploc.com.description: Ziploc Storage Bags, freezer grade quart size, are durable and perfect for organizing odds and ends within larger bags when traveling. Light, cheap, waterproof, and useful.

Graphic Design.description: An organization may have dedicated design resources, outsource to independent contractors on a per-project basis, or may need to be done by developer relations roles themselves.

Technical Writing.description: Tools that support teams with technical writing. This is inclusive of documentation and blogging solutions for creating tutorials, blog posts, etc.

Public Speaking.description: Tools that support public speaking. This is inclusive of presentation software, slide decks, and other devices used to create and deliver presentations.

User Experience.description: Tools that can help support defining or understanding user experience. This includes designing user interfaces and mockups as well as collecting feedback from users.

Developer Marketing.description: Tools that can help support developer marketing activities. This includes content management systems, website builders, and other tools used to create and manage marketing websites (including Developer Portals).

Web Development.description: Tools used for web development. This includes static site generators, content management systems, and other tools used to create and manage websites.

Video Production.description: Tools used for the production of audio and video media. This includes video editing software, screen recording tools, and other tools used to create and manage video content.

Social Media.description: Tools that are used for managing online communities through social media including scheduling posts, managing accounts, analyzing performance, etc.

Community Management.description: Tools used for managing online communities, forums, and discussion boards.

Event Management.description: Tools that support event staff and organizers in managing in-person events.

Team Lead.description: Tools that support team leadership for internal collaboration, reporting and management.

create infographics.description:
Infographics can convey complex information visually which aids with understanding. It may convey graphically relationships between objects, quantitative information summarized, etc.

This may include architecture diagrams, dataflow diagrams, E-R diagrams, and similar development-oriented tasks.

create graphic design assets.description: Graphic design assets unite a brand to tell a story and may take many forms such as page dividers, social banners, in-page graphic elements, etc.

create a logo.description: The company logo and variations of it are central to the design system of a product. There are tools that help specifically to design and edit logos.

create an avatar.description: The individual person or company mascot provides a personification of a brand in the form of an avatar.

create a user interface mockup.description: A mockup helps convey interactions and visual elements that must be constructed by others in either low fidelity or full design elements to help understand the scope of work.

create a tutorial.description: Created a tutorial that helps explain how to accomplish a goal or task, such as how-to guides with step-by-step instructions. May be a blog, documentation page, workshop, or video.

create a conceptual guide.description: Create a conceptual guide that explains from first principles how to accomplish tasks within a domain. This typically includes a fair amount of background that is explained progressively for greater understanding compared to tutorials or reference documentation that may more directly intend to address a question.

create an API reference.description: Create an API reference that explains the input parameters and output responses of a developer-facing API. This can be done with typical documentation tools but may also be generated from the specificiation for a dynamic or interactive experience.

create a website.description: Create a website to explain what the product or service offerred is. This includes static websites, progressive web-apps, or output from a CMS.

create a video tutorial.description: Similar to tutorials or guides in written form, a video tutorial is a multimedia presentation that requires specific tools to create, edit, and publish.

schedule social media posts.description: When the desired outcome is to schedule posts to publish in advance across multiple social channels.

social listening alerts.description: When the desired outcome is to set up alerts for brand mentions across multiple channels.

provide community support.description: When the desired outcome is to provide technical support to a community through open forums, discussion boards, or other community management tools.

traveled to an event.description: When the desired outcome is to travel to a remote location for an event such as a conference, tradeshow, meetup, on-site.

created a presentation.description: When the desired outcome is to create a presentation, often using slides or other visual aids.

collected audience insights.description: When the desired outcome is to poll and collect insights, data and feedback from the audience during a presentation.

want imagery to support a project.description: The situation is one where imagery is needed to support a project.

manage documentation for a project.description: Whether setting up docs from scratch or existing documentation to migrate for a project, this situation requires a tool to help with documentation management.

manage a public website.description: The situation is one where a website needs to be created or managed, such as a Developer Portal or other marketing site using content management systems and website builders.

host a video production.description: The situation is one where a program or event needs to be hosted, such as a live stream, webinar, or virtual event.

provide instructions.description: The situation is one where documentation needs to be written or edited to explain how to accomplish a goal.

want to manage social media accounts.description: The situation is one where social media accounts need to be managed, such as scheduling posts, engaging with the audience, and analyzing performance.

want to build an online community.description: The situation where an online community needs to be built or managed.

working on the go.description: When the situation requires working remotely while traveling and staying productive.

remote collaboration.description: The situation is one where team members need to collaborate remotely, often using digital tools to communicate and share common work output.

make information clearer.description: A picture to complement other information can help make relationships and structure much more clear.

create a visual identity.description: A collection of visual elements can be reused by others for various purposes.

make information engaging.description: A polished experience with visual elements can grab a user's attention to make it more engaging and emphasize ideas, manage flow through a page, or identify similar items within visual groupings.

help visualize an idea.description: Capture complex or abstract ideas into something visual that helps others imagine what a thing might look like.

organize knowledge.description: Organize knowledge in a way that is easy to understand and navigate.

ensure clear communication.description: Ensure that the quality of the writing meets the standards required for understanding and clarity.

internal collaboration.description: A tool that helps with collaboration, so that multiple team members can work together on a project, share ideas, and provide feedback.

external contributors.description: A tool that allows for external contributors, so that the community can help with documentation, tutorials, or other content.

reuse specification and inline documenta.description: Inline documentation or specifications from source-code is a way to document code directly within the codebase, and allows for reuse in generating user documentation.

deliver marketing messages and positioni.description: A tool that helps deliver marketing messages and positioning, so that the company can effectively communicate its value proposition to developers.

engage the audience.description: A tool that helps engage the audience during presentations, making the experience more interactive and participatory.
